Job Title: Oncology Region Operations Lead- South- Remote

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

About The Role

This is a field-based and remote opportunity.

Ready to make a real difference to the lives of cancer patients and their families? With many new molecular entities in our clinical pipeline, we have an incredible opportunity to transform cancer care. And you can be part of it. Bring your experience, passion and customer focus to our sales team and help introduce breakthrough cancer medicines to patients in need.

Job Purpose

 The Region Strategy and Operations Lead - South plays a critical role in developing, deploying and enabling successful execution of the long-term vision and strategy for the region. The role leads the strategic planning process, develops processes and deploys platforms to assess progress in the delivery d of key business objectives. The purpose of this role is to support the Region GM and works as a member of the Regional Executive Team to develop and execute successful strategic business plans and initiatives that deliver on cross functional regional goals and KPIs focused on Oncology Portfolio commercial growth and successful customer engagement. This role is accountable for identifying operational efficiencies and business strategies to drive business performance across the Novartis oncology portfolio and to ensure a strong team and customer experience through effective communications, engagement utilization of tools, resources, account planning, and training.

This is a remote opportunity. The ideal candidate will live in the southern region of the United States; however, this is a Remote role.

Major Accountabilities

Region Strategy

 Work closely with the Region Executive Team to develop a strategic blueprint aligning priorities and objectives, identify needed capabilities, and monitor execution of the strategic plan, as well as make recommendations for adjustments throughout the planning period Regional Performance tracking: Lead a cross-functional team to develop a comprehensive platform for measuring performance based on internal and external qualitative and quantitative inputs. Synthesize insights for engagement with regional teams and with senior CE & HQ leadership. Collaborate with internal cross-functional partners to drive regional coordination with customer engagement operations and skills/capabilities teams as well as other HQ functions that are operational enablers for the team

Leadership strategic advisory and business operations

 Support Region GM, Regional Sales Director and CE Priority Account leads in coordinating projects and initiatives with HQ teams, and monitor progress Support the Region GM on coordinating responses to various requests and in preparing for leadership meetings. Act as delegate for GM and be the voice of Customer Engagement on national initiatives and brand workstreams. Support Regional Sales Director on tracking of relevant SF KPI (e g Reach / frequency, call quality) and rollout of promotional strategies to the sales team. Work with Sales leadership team on data needs to drive performance and behaviors. Support regional leadership with integration of change management practices related to structure, process, ways of working and tactical execution Communication/ Engagement Plan: Develop and execute a comprehensive communication plan for all stakeholders in the Region (blogs, town halls, webcasts, recognition, etc.) in collaboration with Business Planning & Strategy role for Head of Oncology. Culture & People: Work with Regional leadership to nurture culture and advance people initiatives that attract, retain and grow talent

Operational Excellence on Region Priorities

 Serve as a liaison across functions and support pull through of key initiatives. Lead the planning, execution, and follow up for business reviews and national/regional meetings Orchestrate Cross Region alignment and best practice sharing Manage the Region calendar to ensure appropriate alignment between priorities and scheduling Track the allocation and utilization of resources, regional operations budget, provides advice and recommendations on maximizing value from available resource Driving is an essential function of this role, meaning it is fundamental to the purpose of this job and cannot be eliminated. Because driving is an essential function of the role, you must have a fully valid and unrestricted driver’s license to be qualified for this role.

The company provides reasonable accommodations for otherwise qualified individuals with medical restrictions if an accommodation can be provided without eliminating the essential function of driving.

COVID-19 Vaccine Policy (customer-facing roles only): While Novartis does not require vaccination for COVID-19 or proof of a recent negative test result for COVID-19 at this time, employees working in customer-facing roles must adhere to and comply with customers’ (such as hospitals, physician offices, etc.) credentialing guidelines, which may require vaccination. As required by applicable law, Novartis will consider requests for reasonable accommodation for those unable to be vaccinated. This requirement is subject to applicable state and local laws and may not be applicable to employees working in certain jurisdictions. Please send accommodation requests to Eh.occupationalhealth@novartis.com.

Novartis Compensation and Benefit Summary: The pay range for this position at commencement of employment is expected to be between $166,400 and $249 600/year, however, while salary ranges are effective from 1/1/24 through 12/31/24, fluctuations in the job market may necessitate adjustments to pay ranges during this period.  Further, final pay determinations will depend on various factors, including, but not limited to geographical location, experience level, knowledge, skills, and abilities. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a sign-on bonus, restricted stock units, and discretionary awards in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors. 

EEO Statement

We are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.

Accessibility and Reasonable Accommodations: Individuals in need of a reasonable accommodation due to a medical condition or disability for any part of the application process, or to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know the nature of your request, your contact information and the job requisition number in your message:

Role Requirements

Essential Requirements

 College degree-required, advanced degree preferred A minimum of 7 years of experience in pharmaceutical or life sciences business management or operational roles; sales, marketing, market access, incentives or strategy experience preferred A minimum of 2 years in sales leadership preferred Experience working in account-based customer engagement environment preferred Demonstrated ability to quickly build relationships to collaborate with and influence cross functional stakeholders Sophisticated interpersonal skills including written and oral communication skills, ability to synthesize data, interpret and translate into compelling and clear strategies and plans. Proven ability to manage and successfully execute multiple parallel projects in a highly visible and fast paced environment Demonstrated ability to achieve organizational objectives by working through others, including the ability to anticipate, adapt, own and/or work in a group to support changing business needs Demonstrated prioritization, organizational, analytical and research skills, and the ability to conceptualize complex issues, processes, and solutions

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

You’ll Receive: You can find everything you need to know about our benefits and rewards in the Novartis Life Handbook. https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams’ representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

For Field Roles with a Dedicated Training Period: The individual hired for this role will be required to successfully complete certain initial training, including home study, in eight (8) or fewer hours per day and forty (40) or fewer hours per week.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
